wikipedia_page.main: Reginald Thomas John Levinge (1813–1848) was a British aristocrat and second in line to the Levinge baronetcy but never became baronet. He served as a commander in the Royal Navy. He was donor of the some of the Levinge Papers which are held in the National Library of Ireland.

response: A cemetery was begun some time in the early 19th century. It was used both for deaths on the island and for burial of persons dying on ships within one day's sail of the island. Graves of note include Captain William Bafe and his crew, and Commodore Reginald Thomas John Levinge of the Levinge baronets.
Richard was brother to Commodore Reginald Thomas John Levinge of the Royal Navy.
His daughter Elizabeth Anne Parkyns married Sir Richard Levinge and threy were parents to Reginald Thomas John Levinge.

In 1846 under Hotham she joined the Experimental Squadron in Portsmouth. After a brief time back with Captain Crouch it passed to Reginald Thomas John Levinge, third son of Sir Richard Levinge, baronet. This was still off the coast of West Africa. In September 1847 command passed to Commander Reynell Charles Michell for 12 months who took her to the Cape of Good Hope.Times (newspaper) 21 April 1848
